title: Air Manas
text:
Air Manas is a <a href="low-cost%20airline">low-cost airline</a> based in <a href="Bishkek">Bishkek</a>, <a href="Kyrgyzstan">Kyrgyzstan</a>. Its main base is <a href="Manas%20International%20Airport">Manas International Airport</a>.
History.
Air Manas was founded in 2006 in <a href="Bishkek">Bishkek</a>. First flight of Air Manas was carried out in December 2009. In June 2012, 49% of the air company was bought by a Turkish <a href="Pegasus%20Airlines">Pegasus Airlines</a>. The first flight under the brand name Pegasus Asia was operated from <a href="Bishkek">Bishkek</a> to <a href="Istanbul">Istanbul</a> on 22 March 2013 . Now the airline operates domestic flights between <a href="Bishkek">Bishkek</a> to <a href="Osh">Osh</a>, as well as international flights from Kyrgyzstan to India, Russia, Turkey and China.
Rebirth.
The efforts of the Kyrgyz Government to attract foreign investments had borne fruit: mutual visits of high-level governmental delegations gave a serious impetus to bilateral trade relations between Turkey and Kyrgyzstan. Thus, at the end of 2012 in the basis of pre-existing airline, a new Kyrgyz airline with the same name of "Air Manas" was created, being 51% owned by the Kyrgyz side and 49% by newly attracted strategic partner <a href="Pegasus%20Airlines">Pegasus Airlines</a>, one of the <a href="List%20of%20largest%20airlines%20in%20Europe">leading air companies in Europe</a>.
The base airport for Air Manas, is the main airport - International Airport Manas, located near Bishkek. In its fleet, Air Manas uses an Airbus A220, and it formerly operated Boeing 737-400 and 737-800 NG.
Air Manas has its own certified aviation-technical base for the operational maintenance of aircraft. Despite the lack of any incidents, the airline along with all airlines based in Kyrgyzstan are on the <a href="list%20of%20air%20carriers%20banned%20in%20the%20European%20Union">list of air carriers banned in the European Union</a>.
